channel.title: Our World in Data - Data Insights
channel.description: Data Insights from Our World in Data

item.title: Declining child mortality, fast and slow
item.description: Two centuries ago, about one in three children in Sweden died before they were five years old, as you can see on the chart.

item.title: A record number of objects went into space in 2023
item.description: 2,664 objects were launched into space in 2023. This figure breaks the record set the previous year.

item.title: Indonesia’s shift to cleaner cooking fuels has greatly improved air quality and health
item.description: In 2000, less than 10% of the population in Indonesia had access to clean cooking fuels. This is now over 80%, as the chart shows.

item.title: Extreme poverty in China has been almost eliminated — first in urban, then in rural regions
item.description: In 1981, 97% of people in the Chinese countryside lived in extreme poverty. Even in cities, it was more than 70%.

item.title: Solar and wind gain an edge over coal in a number of countries
item.description: Solar and wind have surpassed coal as a source of electricity generation in a number of countries, as the chart shows. This marks a substantial shift towards more sustainable sources of energy.

item.title: Differences in life expectancy across the world are extremely large
item.description: People in richer countries tend to live much longer than those in poorer countries.

item.title: Pacemakers are crucial to people with heart rhythm disorders, but their adoption varies widely
item.description: Pacemakers are crucial medical devices for people with heart disorders and irregular heartbeats. They provide a steady heart rhythm and help the heart pump blood effectively to the rest of the body.
